TEXT:
Nach der Pleite in Niedersachsen wÃ¤chst der Druck auf CDU-Chefin Merkel, ihre Partei neu aufzustellen

Die aber gibt sich unbeeindruckt - und ruft ihre parteiinternen Kritiker auf den Plan

Von RÃ¼cktritt ist die Rede - und einem Neuanfang mit einem neuen Kanzlerkandidaten

Es ist der Tag nach der Niedersachsen-Pleite. Doch Kanzlerin Merkel wirkt, als kommentiere sie das frÃ¶hliche Herbstwetter.

Ihre Partei sei durch die Wahl nicht geschwÃ¤cht, sie gehe "selbstbewusst in die SondierungsgesprÃ¤che zu Jamaika", erklÃ¤rt sie am Montag im Konrad-Adenauer-Haus.

Viele andere in der Partei starren nur auf die schlechten Ergebnisse in Niedersachsen und bei der Bundestagswahl zwei Wochen zuvor. Sie sprechen von einem Ende der Ã„ra Merkel - und laden ihren Frust ab.

Wie etwa bei der Bundestagsabgeordneten Sylvia Pantel.

Unter der OberflÃ¤che brodelt es

Ihr Telefon stand am Morgen nicht mehr still. Bei ihr meldeten sich aufgebrachte Parteifreunde, denen die Geduld ausgeht. "Sie fÃ¼rchten, dass wir noch weitere Stimmen an die AfD verlieren und sorgen sich um das Profil unserer Partei", sagt sie im HuffPost-GesprÃ¤ch. "Ich kann das nachvollziehen".

Pantel erwartet von ihrer Partei nun VerÃ¤nderungen. Und die mÃ¼ssen ganz oben anfangen. Es brauche einen Merkel-Nachfolger.

"Die CDU muss einen Kandidaten aufbauen", fordert sie. "Nichte heute, nicht morgen, aber in der Mitte der Legislatur brauchen wir hier Klarheit." Vor vier Jahren habe man die Nachfolgeregelung versÃ¤umt. Jetzt sei es hÃ¶chste Zeit. "Ich bin Ã¼berzeugt davon, dass ein GroÃŸteil der CDU-WÃ¤hler kein "Weiter so" will."

"Ein Kandidat, der Merkel ablÃ¶sen soll"

Pantel ist klar, dass sie damit ein Tabu in der Politik bricht.

In der Ã–ffentlichkeit wird nicht Ã¼ber die Zeit nach dem Amtsinhaber spekuliert. Pantel macht das trotzdem - und hofft, dass mÃ¶glichst viele in der CDU mitmachen. "HÃ¤ufig ist es doch so: Wer sich zuerst mit einer guten Idee herauswagt, wird Ã¶ffentlich an den Pranger gestellt. Zwei Jahre spÃ¤ter wollen es dann alle gesagt haben."

Ganz alleine ist sie in der CDU mit ihrer Forderung aber nicht.

"Unreflektiertes Weiterso"

Die Werteunion, ein Zusammenschluss konservativer Kreise der Partei, fordert gar Merkels RÃ¼cktritt. Der Zusammenschluss verschickte eilig nach den ersten Hochrechnung einen "Fahrplan zur Ãœbergabe der Kanzlerschaft".

Merkel mÃ¼sse als Parteivorsitzende zurÃ¼cktreten, heiÃŸt es darin. Die WÃ¤hler in Niedersachsen hÃ¤tten ein "unreflektiertes Weiterso der Kanzlerin nach der desastrÃ¶sen Bundestagswahl abgestraft".

Solche Maximalforderungen liegen auf der EmpÃ¶rungsskala freilich ganz weit oben und sind sicher nicht merheitsfÃ¤hig in der CDU. Auch wollen einflussreiche CDU-Politiker davon nichts wissen. Die Frage stelle sich nicht, sagen sie - oder drÃ¼cken sich moderater aus.

"Unangreifbarkeit von Merkel ist nicht mehr aufrechtzuerhalten"

Der CDU-Wirtschaftsrat etwa gab der Kanzlerin am Sonntag eine Mitschuld an dem niedersÃ¤chsischen Ergebnis.

"Der SchlÃ¼ssel fÃ¼r die Niederlage in Hannover liegt leider im Berliner Wahlabend am 24. September, als man die verheerenden Verluste von Ã¼ber acht Prozent zu einem strategischen Sieg schÃ¶ngeredet hat", sagt der GeneralsekretÃ¤r Wolfgang Steiger der "Bild".

Und CSU-GeneralsekretÃ¤r Andreas Scheuer sprach von einem "Alarmsignal fÃ¼r die gesamte Union".

Angesichts solcher Ã„uÃŸerungen beschreiben Beobachter Merkel mindestens als angeschlagen.

"Die Position von Merkel ist in ihrer Unangreifbarkeit nicht mehr aufrechtzuerhalten", sagt etwa der Politik-Experte Wolfgang Oberreuter im GesprÃ¤ch mit der HuffPost.

"Merkels Beruhigungspillen werden einige in der Partei nicht mehr anstandslos schlucken", sagt er. Und in dem Augenblick, in dem Ã¼ber ihre Nachfolge offen diskutiert werde, sei ihre FÃ¼hrungskraft geschwÃ¤cht.

"Massive inhaltliche Auseinandersetzungen"

Noch deutlicher drÃ¼ckt sich der Berliner Politologe Albrecht von Lucke aus. "Merkels Ende ist eingeleitet", sagte er dem Nachrichtensender N24. Es gehe vor allem um eine "massive inhaltliche Auseinandersetzung" in der Partei - eine Art Stellvertreterkrieg der Merkel-AnhÃ¤nger und -Gegner.

"Eine Fraktion macht sich stark, die die Union nach rechts ziehen will". Dass das sogar die SondierungsgesprÃ¤che mit den Jamaika-Parteien treffen kÃ¶nnte, gab sogar Merkel indirekt zu.

Die Gefahr ist groÃŸ, dass sich die Verhandlungsparteien mit ihren Forderungen und roten Linien Ã¼berwerfen, allen voran die angeschlagene Union. Die GesprÃ¤che werden deswegen einige Wochen dauern, sagte die Kanzlerin.

Wenigstens das klang nicht so, als ginge es gerade ums Wetter.

FlÃ¼chtlingskrise: Helft den Helfern! Die FlÃ¼chtlingskrise bewegt die Deutschen wie kein anderes Thema. Viele blicken fassungslos auf das, was sich an Europas Grenzen abspielt. Auf das Leiden und die NÃ¶te der Hilfesuchenden. Dabei gibt es zahlreiche Menschen und Organisationen, die vor Ort helfen, die Probleme zu lÃ¶sen. Wie ihr selbst aktiv werden kÃ¶nnt, erfahrt ihr bei unserem Kooperationspartner Betterplace..

(mf)
TITLE: "Merkels Ende ist eingeleitet": Die Niedersachsen-Wahl erschÃ¼ttert die Union

ConcrÃ¨tement, mÃªme s'il n'existe pas de formule magique, le quotidien recÃ¨le d'instants qui sont autant d'occasions pour inculquer Ã  son fils quelles sont les limites Ã  ne pas franchir. Dans ce genre de situations, "il faut leur dire que leur corps leur appartient et qu'il ne peut pas Ãªtre touchÃ©, que si Ã§a arrive il faut l'empÃªcher", indique Christine Barois. Et donc leur expliquer que, par comparaison, le corps des autres appartient aux autres.

L'essentiel, pour Carole Bloch, Ã©tant de "mettre des mots dessus, dÃ¨s le plus jeune Ã¢ge, de ne pas en faire un sujet tabou". Comme l'expose trÃ¨s bien dans cette tribune Carina Kolodny, directrice des plates-formes multimÃ©dias du HuffPost amÃ©ricain, expliquer Ã  sa fille comment ne pas Ãªtre violÃ©e est dÃ©sagrÃ©able, expliquer Ã  son fils comment ne pas violer l'est peut-Ãªtre encore plus. SUMMARY:
CANBERRA -- Goodbye 'Clean Energy Target', we did not even know you.
It will be set by the Australian Energy Market Commission (AEMC) and Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO); An emissions guarantee will be set to contribute to Australia's international commitments.
Although this is early analysis and further modelling will be undertaken by the Australian Energy Market Commission (AEMC).
"[A clean energy target] is bullet point number two out of three bullet points and it's not even introduced as a Clean Energy Target, it introduced as the need for a credible mechanism.
@ScienceChiefAu Alan Finkel: The clean energy target is the preferred mechanism to achieve this trajectory.
TEXT:
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull: "No more industry policy, no more picking winners, no more favouring one technology after another."

CANBERRA -- Goodbye 'Clean Energy Target', we did not even know you.

Hello 'National Energy Guarantee'.

Describing it as a "game changer," the Turnbull Government has dumped the Chief Scientist's suggestion of a Clean Energy Target (CET) mechanism for investing in new power and will instead pursue lower power prices by allowing the phasing out of renewable energy subsidies and bolstering baseload power in introducing a National Energy Guarantee (NET).

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull announced a new "pro market" energy plan, which has been ticked of by Cabinet and the joint government partyroom on Tuesday, saying it will deliver "affordable and reliable electricity".

"Your power bills are too high, and rising too fast," Turnbull said in the video, selling the plan and later told reporters in Canberra that "what we have today is a game changer".

"This is a national energy guarantee that will ensure that we have affordable power. That is reliable. We keep the lights on and we can afford to keep them on, and that we meet our international commitments under the Paris Agreement to cut our emissions."

"In other words, it delivers affordability, reliability and responsibility."

#BREAKING: Finkel's plan for a CET to meet Australia's obligations under the Paris Agreement has been dumped by the Federal Gov't #auspol pic.twitter.com/ucy8363VXw â€” Climate Council (@climatecouncil) October 16, 2017

The key is that coal, gas, hydro and biomass will be rewarded for their "dispatchability", or the required amount of power on demand, while wind, solar and hydro will be recognised as lower emissions technologies, but they will no longer be subsidised.

The National Energy Guarantee is a two part direction to energy retailers across the National Electricity Market to use a required percentage of electricity from so-called dispatchable sources such as coal and gas, batteries or pumped hydro.

A reliability guarantee will be set to deliver the right level of dispatchable energy (from ready-to-use sources such as coal, gas, pumped hydro and batteries) needed in each state. It will be set by the Australian Energy Market Commission (AEMC) and Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO);

will be set to deliver the right level of dispatchable energy (from ready-to-use sources such as coal, gas, pumped hydro and batteries) needed in each state. It will be set by the Australian Energy Market Commission (AEMC) and Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO); An emissions guarantee will be set to contribute to Australia's international commitments. The level of the guarantee will be determined by the Commonwealth and enforced by the Australian Energy Regulator (AER).

The Government cites an estimate from the Energy Security Board, which recommended the NEG, that "typical" household bills will fall by an average of $110-$115 per year over the 2020-2030 period. Although this is early analysis and further modelling will be undertaken by the Australian Energy Market Commission (AEMC).

Energy Minister Josh Frydenberg described the policy as "credible" and "pro-market".

"It means no subsidies, no taxes, no trading systems," he told reporters.

One of the "big three" energy retailers gives the Government's new energy plan its backing #auspol https://t.co/vpLxi4vHt3 â€” Jane Norman (@janeenorman) October 17, 2017

Renewable energy is not being disregarded, but Turnbull equates subsidies with ideology and said the Government scheme designed to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in the electricity sector, the Renewable Energy Target, which is due to end in 2020, "will be, in effect, filled by 2020".

Government chief scientist Alan Finkel appeared to back the plan in a press conference on Tuesday afternoon. He acknowledged that the idea of a 'clean energy target' had not been adopted, but also that he never technically recommended one in his review of the nation's energy system.

"There's always more than one way to skin a cat and 49 out of the 50 recommendations were very rapidly agreed to, there was one that was awkward for various reasons," he said.

"[A clean energy target] is bullet point number two out of three bullet points and it's not even introduced as a Clean Energy Target, it introduced as the need for a credible mechanism. There are multiple ways of achieving a credible mechanism."

.@ScienceChiefAu Alan Finkel: The clean energy target is the preferred mechanism to achieve this trajectory. MORE: https://t.co/6szw4MMJQV pic.twitter.com/ts21olOmgv â€” Sky News Australia (@SkyNewsAust) October 17, 2017

"On the surface of it, it looks to me like something that it will be absolutely capable of achieving the goal, which is to give a tool to the operator to make sure we get the lower emissions generation coming into the market."

The PM also notes wind and solar are now financially competitive with new builds of thermal power and the Government must "not pick winners".

"So there is no need for a subsidy. In other words, they can compete on a level playing field," he said.

Labor wants to see the modelling. Labor leader Bill Shorten attacked the new policy in question time as no guarantee of lower consumer power prices, asking Turnbull, "when can the Prime Ninister guarantee Australians that the cost of their power bills will go down?"

"That sends a message to renewable energy investors that once again Aus is closed for business," John Grimes @SolarCouncil on energy policy pic.twitter.com/9SNzCrA4KZ â€” ABC News (@abcnews) October 17, 2017

An energised Turnbull backed the formal advice from the Energy Security Board and said the Government had arranged for the Opposition to have a briefing.

"We encourage them to get on board and adopt this expert recommendation that for the first time will level the playing field, end the subsidies, end the taxes, and ensure that we have a genuinely technology-agnostic energy market that enables us to have energy that is affordable, reliable and responsible," he told parliament.

"That is what Labor should support. Stop the nonsense about their claimed bipartisanship and get real and get on board with the plan that guarantees Australia's energy future."

Form prime minister Tony Abbott, who has been advocating a rejection of the CET, has claimed credit but wants more.

Progress at today's party room. The Clean Energy Target has been definitively dropped. â€” Tony Abbott (@TonyAbbottMHR) October 17, 2017

One Nation has also claimed credit.
TITLE: Malcolm Turnbull's New 'Game Changer' Energy Plan Secures Old Power

SUMMARY:
"Congress is an equal partner in GST decision and it should not spread lies about GST.
The decision was not taken by Parliament or Narendra Modi.
"Congress is an equal partner in GST decision and it should not spread lies about GST."
"You are equally responsible for the decision," he said while addressing a huge rally of BJP party workers in poll-bound Gujarat at Bhat village here.
The prime minister said a "fear psychosis" was being created over the issue.
TEXT:
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi (L) addresses a gathering of Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) supporters during Gujarat Gaurav Mahasamellan at Bhaat village on the outskirts of Ahmedabad on October 16, 2017.

ADVERTISEMENT

Gandhinagar â€“ Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said Goods and Services Tax (GST) was a collective decision of various state governments in which the Centre had a small role to play and the Congress was "an equal partner".

"Congress is an equal partner in GST decision and it should not spread lies about GST. The decision was not taken by Parliament or Narendra Modi. The decision was made by governments of all political parties, including the Congress governments of Punjab, Karnataka, and Meghalaya," Modi said.

"Congress is an equal partner in GST decision and it should not spread lies about GST."

He said the central government was "only the 30th part" in the decision which was taken in consultation with 29 states.

"You are equally responsible for the decision," he said while addressing a huge rally of BJP party workers in poll-bound Gujarat at Bhat village here.

Modi said he has been in touch with businessmen after the launch of the GST and claimed they like the system because it has freed them from bureaucratic red tape.

He said, as promised, his government reviewed the way the new indirect tax regime was working after three months following which several changes were made to fulfil their demands.

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi (C/R) and Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) President Amitbhai Shah (2nd L), wave to the supporters on their arrival at Gujarat Gaurav Mahasamellan at Bhaat village on the outskirts of Ahmedabad on October 16, 2017.

Modi also assured the business community that the government is trying to sort out problems they are still facing.

"I am sure that businessmen of the country need this system, but they demand simplicity. This is being put before the GST (Council) and discussed collectively," he said.

He also tried to assuage the concerns of the trading community about penal action they might face for their past accounting. The prime minister said a "fear psychosis" was being created over the issue.

Modi said businessmen will not need to adjust their past books to synchronise them with the new system.

He also attacked the Congress over observing November 8, the day demonetisation was announced last year, as "black day", something which his government would celebrate as "black money mukti diwas" (day of freedom from black money).

Modi said following demonetisation the sources of origin of Rs 3 lakh crore of dubious money are being probed and his government has shut down 2.10 lakh companies without any protest.

"So far we have shut down 2.10 lakh companies and there has been no protest or burning of Modi's effigy," he said.
TITLE: 'Congress Equally Responsible For GST', Says PM Who Called It A 'Landmark Achievement' During July Launch

SYRIE - Raqqa est tombÃ©e. Moins d'un an aprÃ¨s le lancement de l'opÃ©ration "ColÃ¨re de l'Euphrate" dÃ©but novembre 2016, les Forces dÃ©mocratiques syriennes ont Ã©liminÃ© les derniers terroristes retranchÃ©s dans la "capitale" syrienne du groupe Ã‰tat islamique qu'il occupait depuis juin 2013, a annoncÃ© l'Observatoire syrien des droits de l'Homme ce mardi 17 octobre. Une nouvelle dÃ©faite symbolique pour les djihadistes qui perdent leur derniÃ¨re grande ville dans la zone irako-syrienne, un peu plus de trois mois aprÃ¨s la chute de Mossoul.

La reprise de Raqqa, tout premier bastion du groupe extrÃ©miste sunnite, est une victoire cruciale pour les FDS, soutenus par la coalition internationale. Les combattants de l'Ã‰tat islamique avaient fait de cette ville bordÃ©e par l'Euphrate, dans le centre de la Syrie, leur capitale militaire au mÃªme titre que Mossoul en Irak.

En revanche, si la victoire est importante, elle ne marque pas pour autant la fin de la guerre contre le groupe ultraradical, responsable d'atrocitÃ©s dans les zones sous son contrÃ´le et d'attentats meurtriers dans le monde. PrivÃ©s de leur zone d'influence, le djihadistes entendent bien transformer leur organisation pour revenir Ã  la guÃ©rilla, le harcÃ¨lement et les assassinats.

Une chute anticipÃ©e

"C'est bien Ã©videmment un coup dur portÃ© Ã  Daech. Mais les dirigeants de l'organisation ont fait le deuil de cette perte symbolique depuis longtemps", explique le spÃ©cialiste des mouvements et mouvances jihadistes Wassim Nasr au HuffPost. Une analyse partagÃ©e par l'agrÃ©gÃ© d'histoire StÃ©phane Mantoux: "Ils savent qu'il leur est impossible de garder les grandes villes de Syrie et d'Irak", expliquait-il lors de la reprise de Mossoul.

DÃ©sormais, le but des combattants de Daech est de tenir le plus longtemps possible dans les environs de Raqqa, mais Ã©galement Ã  Deir ez-Zor, Hawija, et sur les quelques terres qu'ils contrÃ´lent encore. MÃªme si "Ã  terme, l'Ã‰tat islamique perd tous ses territoires Ã  cause Ã  la pression militaire de la coalition", les soldats du Califat combattront jusqu'au bout, pour glorifier leur organisation et "construire leur lÃ©gende", selon le journaliste Ã  France 24 Wassim Nasr.

"Ils veulent tenir tÃªte au maximum face Ã  la coalition et aux forces Ã©trangÃ¨res, ce qu'aucune armÃ©e arabe n'a rÃ©ussi Ã  le faire", explique-t-il. Une faÃ§on pour eux de ne pas perdre toute leur influence dans la zone irako-syrienne et de prÃ©parer la mue de l'organisation.

Changement de stratÃ©gie

Sur le terrain, l'Ã‰tat islamique recule trÃ¨s nettement depuis le dÃ©but de l'annÃ©e 2016. L'organisation a notamment perdu Falloujah, Mossoul, Palmyre et donc Raqqa. Des grandes villes qui apportaient, entre autres, beaucoup d'argent, et qui permettaient aux responsables de Daech de rÃ©pandre leurs idÃ©es et de planifier des attentats en Europe. C'est depuis Raqqa que Rachid Kassim aurait par exemple planifiÃ© la plupart des attaques terroristes commises en France depuis Charlie Hebdo.

L'Ã‰tat islamique perd sa vocation Ã©tatique" Wassim Nasr

Mais ces dÃ©faites successives obligent l'Ã‰tat islamique Ã  se repenser. En quittant ces villes, l'organisation abandonne Ã©galement sa vocation Ã©tatique. Selon le journaliste de France 24, les dirigeants de Daech se satisfont de la situation malgrÃ© les dÃ©faites successives: "ce sont des gens pragmatiques", estime-t-il. En n'ayant plus de villes Ã  gÃ©rer, ni d'habitants Ã  administrer, l'Ã‰tat islamique pourra dÃ©sormais se concentrer sur son retour au "statut insurrectionnel."

Un retour Ã  la guÃ©rilla, et de nouvelles zones d'influence

Le retour au premier plan de Daech ne passera pas par la prise d'une ville ou la dÃ©fense d'une autre. Les djihadistes vont revenir Ã  "ce qu'ils savent faire de 'mieux'", explique le journaliste de France 24, Ã©galement auteur du livre "Etat Islamique, Le Fait Accompli." "Ils vont ressurgir en retournant Ã  la guÃ©rilla. Ils vont reprendre le harcÃ¨lement, les assassinats dans les provinces pacifiÃ©es, les attaques ciblÃ©es", dÃ©taille-t-il en pointant la fragilitÃ© de la zone irako-syrienne. â€‹â€‹â€‹

La pression militaire de la coalition internationale n'est pas Ã©ternelle et les villes abandonnÃ©es par les terroristes sont en ruine, ou presque. Des circonstances qui crÃ©ent un terreau fertile aux idÃ©es de l'Ã‰tat islamique dans ces zones trÃ¨s instables. "Daech va profiter des problÃ©matiques locales, des millions de personnes dans les camps de rÃ©fugiÃ©s et de l'instabilitÃ© des Ã‰tats pour continuer Ã  exister", explique Wassim Nasr.

Loin de la zone irako-syrienne, les idÃ©es ultraradicales de Daech trouvent Ã©galement de l'Ã©cho sur de nouveaux continents. L'organisation est notamment prÃ©sente au NigÃ©ria, en Afghanistan, aux Philipinnes ou au Bengladesh. "L'Asie est un continent Ã  fort potentiel pour l'Ã‰tat islamique et les dÃ©cideurs en sont conscients", explique Wassim Nasr. DÃ©butÃ©e en mai 2017, la bataille de Marawi, dans l'est du continent, montre bien l'Ã©tendue de la stratÃ©gie de Daech: Ã©tablir de nouvelles zones d'influence pour survivre, en dÃ©pit du recul au Moyen-Orient.
TITLE: Raqqa perdue, Daech va revenir Ã  ses fondamentaux

Eine Hebamme ist die grÃ¶ÃŸte UnterstÃ¼tzung bei einer Geburt

Die Beziehung zwischen Mutter und Hebamme ist dabei sehr wichtig

Diese 30 Bilder zeigen, wie die wichtige Arbeit der Hebammen aussehen kann

Geburtshilfe ist ein umfassender Begriff, der Ã¼berall auf der Welt etwas anders interpretiert wird. Denn die Arbeit von Hebammen kann sehr unterschiedlich aussehen.

Hebammen unterstÃ¼tzen Frauen bei der Geburtsvorbereitung, wÃ¤hrend und nach der Geburt. Sie helfen der werdenden Mutter, wenn sie ihr Kind ohne Schmerzmittel zur Welt bringen will. Oder sie halten die Hand der Frau, wenn sie einen Kaiserschnitt bekommt.

Doch ob Hausgeburt oder Krankenhausgeburt, natÃ¼rliche Geburt oder Kaiserschnitt - das Grundprinzip der Geburtshilfe ist Ã¼berall gleich. Es ist ein Bund zwischen Mutter und Hebamme.

Zu ehren der "Nationalen Hebammen-Woche", hat die HuffPost US die "International Association of Professional Birth Photographers" (IAPBP) kontaktiert und die Mitglieder gebeten, ihre liebsten Bilder von Hebammen bei der Arbeit zu teilen. Die Bilder sind unglaublich faszinierend.

1.

Emily Frigo

"Man sieht die AusrÃ¼stung der Hebamme im Hintergrund, in diesem Moment hat sie diese aber nicht gebraucht. Der Fokus lag hier auf der emotionalen und kÃ¶rperlichen UnterstÃ¼tzung."

Snap Life Photography

"Die Geburt musste kurz vor knapp von zu Hause ins Krankenhaus verlegt werden - die Mutter hatte zu hohen Blutdruck. Das Besondere: Die Hebamme war sogar die GroÃŸmutter des Kindes."

"Die Mutter war sehr erfreut, als sie bemerkte, dass sie drei Jungen aufziehen wird. Sie brachte ihr Baby zu Hause auf die Welt - mit Hilfe von zwei Hebammen, die ihr sehr nahe stehen. Sie hatten sie schon bei ihren vorherigen Geburten unterstÃ¼tzt."

"Hebammen kÃ¶nnen am besten trÃ¶sten."

"Diese frisch gebackene Mutter war unglaublich stolz, ihr erstes Baby kennenzulernen. Die Hebamme des Krankenhauses wusste, dass der Moment viel fÃ¼r die Familie bedeutete und sorgte dafÃ¼r, dass die Eltern gleich nach der Geburt in das Gesicht ihres Babys blicken konnten."

9.

Jessica Worland

"Der Mutter wurde nach ihrer Behandlung gegen Brustkrebs gesagt, dass sie keine Kinder mehr bekommen kÃ¶nnte. Sie Ã¼berraschte alle mit diesem Wunderkind. 10.

"Das war eine schwere Geburt. Die Mutter war sehr erschÃ¶pft und entschied sich fÃ¼r eine EpiduralanÃ¤sthesie, also eine BetÃ¤ubung des RÃ¼ckenmarks. Dadurch empfinden GebÃ¤rende weniger Schmerzen und kÃ¶nnen sich besser entspannen. Monet Nicole

"UnterstÃ¼tzung!"

28.

"In unserem kleinen Land - ich bin dÃ¤nisch - ist es normal, sein Kind zu Hause auf die Welt zu bringen. Nach einer Geburt ist die Hebamme mit ihrer Assistentin in der KÃ¼che, um mit der groÃŸen Schwester des Babys zu frÃ¼hstÃ¼cken. 29.

"Diese Mutter hatte schon eine schwere, erste Geburt, die in einem Kaiserschnitt endete. WÃ¤hrend ihrer zweiten Geburt spielte die Hebamme eine wichtige Rolle - sie nahm der Mutter die Ã„ngste, die sie noch von der ersten Geburt mit sich trug."

30.

Cat McAteer Photography

"Ein Besuch nach der Geburt kann sehr viel mehr sein, als nur eine Untersuchung des Babys. In dieser Klinik war es ein freundliches LÃ¤cheln, eine groÃŸe Umarmung und gesunde Snacks - und eine gemeinsame Fahrt zur Elternschule."

Das damalige Model beschrieb den Vorfall als â€œkurz, aber Ã¤uÃŸerst ekelerregendâ€.

â–º â€œEr war wie ein Octopusâ€

Jessica Leeds hatte vor 30 Jahren das Pech, auf einem Flug nach New York neben Donald Trump zu sitzen. Die Maschine sei noch keine Stunde in der Luft gewesen, als Leeds Sitznachbar die Armlehne hoch geklappt und ihre BrÃ¼ste begrapscht habe.

AnschlieÃŸend sei er ihr mit der Hand unter den Rock gefahren. â€œSeine HÃ¤nde waren Ã¼berall. Er war wie ein Octopusâ€, sagte die heute 75-JÃ¤hrige gegenÃ¼ber der â€œNew York Timesâ€. Weil die Zeitung darÃ¼ber berichtete, drohte Trump, das Medium zu verklagen.

â–º Wie eine junge Melania

Die frÃ¼here Miss Finland, Nikki Laaksonen, erzÃ¤hlte gegenÃ¼ber der finnischen Zeitung "Ilta Sanomat", Trump habe ihr wÃ¤hrend der Miss Universe Wahl 2006 an den Po gefasst. â€œEr hat richtig fest zugegriffenâ€, so Laaksonen.

SpÃ¤ter habe sie auf einer Party gehÃ¶rt, Trump, der die Ausstrahlung der Misswahl fÃ¼r den Sender NBC produzierte, habe Gefallen an ihr gefunden, weil sie aussÃ¤he wie seine Frau Melania â€“ als sie noch jÃ¼nger war.

â–º â€œEr steckte mir die Zunge in den Halsâ€

â€œPeopleâ€-Redakteurin Natasha Stoynoff behauptet ebenfalls, von Trump begrapscht worden zu sein. Im Jahr 2005 interviewte sie Donald und seine Frau Melania anlÃ¤sslich ihres ersten Hochzeitstages in Trumps Hotel Mar-a-Lago.

Trump habe angeboten, sie durch das Hotel zu fÃ¼hren, doch es sei nur ein Vorwand gewesen, um sie alleine in ein Zimmer zu locken.

â€œEr schloÃŸ die TÃ¼r hinter uns, drÃ¼ckte mich gegen die Wand und steckte mir die Zunge in den Halsâ€, schrieb Stoynoff im Oktober 2016 in einem ExposÃ©. Erst als Trumps Butler einige Minuten spÃ¤ter den Raum betrat, habe sie sich aus seinem Griff befreien kÃ¶nnen.

Noch nicht vom Tisch

Trumps Team streitet sÃ¤mtliche VorwÃ¼rfe ab. Trump selbst versprach im Oktober 2016, dass man gegen jede einzelne dieser â€œhaltlosen Anschuldigungenâ€ klagen wÃ¼rde, sobald die Wahl entschieden sei.

Bis heute ist das nicht passiert.

DafÃ¼r klagt nun Summer Zervos - eine der 16 Betroffenen und ehemalige Kandidatin von Trumps TV-Show â€œApprenticeâ€. Per gerichtlicher Vorladung hat die Amerikanerin sÃ¤mtliche Unterlagen anfordern lassen, die mit den BelÃ¤stigungs-VorwÃ¼rfen gegen den PrÃ¤sidenten in Verbindung stehen - Ausgang offen.

(mf)
TITLE: Der Missbrauchs-Skandal in Hollywood erschÃ¼ttert die USA - dabei sollten wir nicht vergessen, was Trump vorgeworfen wird

SUMMARY:
Restaurant goers are less likely to buy sugary soft drinks if they cost around 10p more, a new study suggests.
The introduction of a 10p levy on sugar sweetened drinks across Jamie Oliverâ€™s restaurant chain Jamieâ€™s Italian has been linked to a fall in sales of those beverages, research found.
The levy was introduced with a reorganisation of the non alcoholic drinks menu where drinks were put into two sections â€“ sugar sweetened drinks or other beverages such as juice, bottled water and diet cola.
Sales fell most sharply in restaurants which were already selling high numbers of soft drinks before the levy.
Part of the strategy saw the introduction of a soft drinks levy.
TEXT:
Restaurant goers are less likely to buy sugary soft drinks if they cost around 10p more, a new study suggests.

The introduction of a 10p levy on sugar sweetened drinks across Jamie Oliverâ€™s restaurant chain Jamieâ€™s Italian has been linked to a fall in sales of those beverages, research found.

The increase in price led to a reduction in sales of up to 11%, according to the study published in the Journal of Epidemiology and Community Health.

Jamieâ€™s Italian used the levy to raise funds for childrenâ€™s health initiatives (Nick Ansell/PA)

In September 2015, Jamieâ€™s Italian added a 10p levy to non-alcoholic sugar sweetened beverages, with proceeds going to a childrenâ€™s health fund which offered grants for child health initiatives.

The levy was introduced with a reorganisation of the non alcoholic drinks menu where drinks were put into two sections â€“ sugar sweetened drinks or other beverages such as juice, bottled water and diet cola.

Researchers from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine and the University of Cambridge decided to take advantage of the â€œnatural experimentâ€ to assess whether the introduction of the levy and reorganisation of the menu had an impact on sales.

Among the 37 restaurants involved in the study, more than two million non-alcoholic drinks were served in the year prior to the introduction of the levy. Of these 38% were sugar sweetened beverages.

Experts examined the impact of a levy on sales of sugary soft drinks (Anthony Devlin/PA)

Twelve weeks after the levy was introduced, sales of sugary drinks per customer fell by 11%, and after six months sales were 9.3% lower than they were before its introduction. Sales fell most sharply in restaurants which were already selling high numbers of soft drinks before the levy.

The authors said that their study showed that â€œfiscal measures could discourage sugar sweetened beverage purchasesâ€ but added that more research was needed to see whether the reductions would be sustained over time.

Steven Cummins, professor of population health at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, said: â€œObesity, type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease are among the most pressing global health challenges facing the world today.

â€œEvidence suggests that excessive consumption of sugar-sweetened beverages is an important contributor to these potentially life-threatening conditions but we still donâ€™t have a clear answer on how best to encourage people to consume fewer of them.

â€œOur study showed that a combination of the levy, menu changes and clearly explaining to customers why it was introduced and that the proceeds would go directly to a worthy cause, looks to have had a relatively large effect on consumer behaviour given the small size of the levy.â€

Type 2 diabetes is among the most pressing global health challenges facing the world today (Peter Byrne/PA)

The celebrity chef was highly critical of the Governmentâ€™s childhood obesity plan, which was published last summer.

He has blamed Theresa Mayâ€™s team for watering down the childhood obesity strategy that David Cameronâ€™s government had been working on.

Part of the strategy saw the introduction of a soft drinks levy.

A two-tier levy of 18p on drinks with 5g of sugar per 100ml and a higher 24p rate on those with more than 8g per 100ml will be introduced from April 2018.

A spokeswoman for the chef said he was not commenting on the latest study.
TITLE: Increasing Price Of Sugary Drinks Cuts Sales, Jamie Oliver Experiment Shows

SUMMARY:
A panel discussion followed the screening presided over by the renowned feminist activist and social scientist Kamla Bhasin, and advocate Kabir Dixit.
The film is an attempt to present the untold story around the lynching of 16-year-old Hafiz Junaid.
A resident of Ballabhgarh, Haryana, Junaid had come to Delhi with his brothers to shop for Eid.
What the film doesn't show but makes the viewer feel is the all-pervasive fear and paranoia following the death of Junaid.
Kamla Bhasin congratulated the young filmmakers for their courage for taking up such a sensitive subject for their first film.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Junaid, a short documentary made by a group of four student filmmakers from AJK MCRC, Jamia Millia Islamia, Sarah Rifai, Raza Ansari, Mehtab Shah and Daud Arif, was recently screened at Khudai Khidmatgar, Ghaffar Manzil, Okhla, New Delhi. The screening was organised by the filmmakers in collaboration with Sabka Ghar, a home to promote communal harmony, and dedicated to all those who have been killed in the name of religion, race, caste, and boundaries. A panel discussion followed the screening presided over by the renowned feminist activist and social scientist Kamla Bhasin, and advocate Kabir Dixit.

The film is an attempt to present the untold story around the lynching of 16-year-old Hafiz Junaid. The teenager was brutally stabbed to death on board a train while on his way back home, a day before Eid. A resident of Ballabhgarh, Haryana, Junaid had come to Delhi with his brothers to shop for Eid. The boy was lynched by a bloodthirsty crowd, which falsely suspected him for a beef eater.

The film endeavours to bring to light the untold story of Junaid's barbaric lynching that went completely unnoticed amidst the television news' race for TRPs, and political mileage.

The film opens with graphic images of Junaid's brother writhing in agony while lying on a railway platform in his bloodstained clothes. It ends with the archival footage of a pensive-looking journalist Ravish Kumar (NDTV) lamenting the loss of an innocent life due to the indifference of the co-passengers who chose not to act when it mattered the most. The documentary shows a mother talk about her dead son with tear-filled eyes, and a teacher talking about the tragic death of his sincere and hardworking pupil. What the film doesn't show but makes the viewer feel is the all-pervasive fear and paranoia following the death of Junaid. The film received unanimous applause from all those present at the screening.

Kamla Bhasin congratulated the young filmmakers for their courage for taking up such a sensitive subject for their first film. She also talked about the importance of bridging the divide between people divided on the basis of religion, caste, gender, or race. Kabir Dixit applauded the filmmakers for being true to the subject without losing their sense of objectivity. He also stressed upon the need to ask the right questions at all times. The team of filmmakers thanked everybody and discussed the challenges they faced during the filming of Junaid while emphasising upon the need to show the truth at all costs.

Egged on by the positive response, the young filmmakers now plan to take the film across the country, hoping to raise awareness about unsavoury elements of society who are trying to destroy the social fabric that binds us together.

A version of this article was first published in A Potpourri of Vestiges.

The opinions expressed in this post are the personal views of the author. They do not necessarily reflect the views of HuffPost India. Any omissions or errors are the author's and HuffPost India does not assume any liability or responsibility for them.
TITLE: 'Junaid': A Pertinent Student Documentary About The Lynching Of A 16-Year-Old Boy

The article, entitled â€œThe Danger of President Pence,â€ details various viewpoints held by the socially conservative vice president that clash with Trumpâ€™s.
Two sources told the magazine that Trump has teased Pence about his positions on religion, abortion and the LGBTQ community.
VP office on Trump hang the gays joke:"The New Yorker piece is filled with unsubstantiated, unsourced claims that are untrue and offensive."

TEXT:
President Donald Trump joked that Vice President Mike Pence â€œwants to hangâ€ all gay people, according to a profile of Pence published in The New Yorker on Monday.

The article, entitled â€œThe Danger of President Pence,â€ details various viewpoints held by the socially conservative vice president that clash with Trumpâ€™s. Two sources told the magazine that Trump has teased Pence about his positions on religion, abortion and the LGBTQ community.

â€œA longtime associateâ€ of Trump and Pence was quoted in the article saying that the president likes to let his VP â€œknow whoâ€™s bossâ€ and that Trump asks people who stop by Penceâ€™s office, â€œDid Mike make you pray?â€

Jonathan Ernst / Reuters

After a legal adviser told Trump and Pence that many states would probably legalize abortion if the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, Trump was said to have turned to Pence:

â€˜You see?â€™ Trump asked Pence. â€˜Youâ€™ve wasted all this time and energy on it, and itâ€™s not going to end abortion anyway.â€™

When that meeting shifted to discuss gay rights, according to the article, Trump pointed to Pence and joked, â€œDonâ€™t ask that guy â€” he wants to hang them all!â€

Penceâ€™s press secretary, Alyssa Farah, told Washington Blade reporter Chris Johnson that the New Yorker article was â€œfilled with unsubstantiated, unsourced claims that are untrue and offensive.â€ It was unclear whether Farahâ€™s statement specifically addressed Trumpâ€™s joke.

VP office on Trump hang the gays joke:"The New Yorker piece is filled with unsubstantiated, unsourced claims that are untrue and offensive." pic.twitter.com/0QTXlJ3Cvh â€” Chris Johnson (@chrisjohnson82) October 16, 2017

Penceâ€™s views on equal rights have long stirred concern in the LGBTQ community. As Indiana governor, he signed his stateâ€™s Religious Freedom Restoration Act in 2015, which essentially gave businesses the right to refuse to serve gay people. He has supported so-called gay conversion therapy and has been called â€œone of the most anti-LGBT politicians out there.â€
TITLE: Trump Reportedly Joked That Pence 'Wants To Hang' All Gays

How much water you drink depends on lots of factors, including how active you are.
'Why is drinking eight glasses of water a day so hard, but eight glasses of wine with dinner so easy?'
There are plenty of ways to make drinking water easier, and none of them involve you forking out for a never-ending supply of Evian.
By diluting it with water, it will not only make it go further, but it means you'll drink more water rather than the concentrated sugar from the juice."

TEXT:
How much water you drink depends on lots of factors, including how active you are.

'Why is drinking eight glasses of water a day so hard, but eight glasses of wine with dinner so easy?'

You may or may not have seen this quote floating around the internet, but regardless, it makes a pretty valid point. Who else has happily swilled wine or Diet Coke or tea by the bucket load, yet struggled to meet their daily water quota?

Never fear. There are plenty of ways to make drinking water easier, and none of them involve you forking out for a never-ending supply of Evian. Before we get onto those, however, let's ask the question...

How much water should I be drinking?

"My stance on this might be a bit of a different take from others', but I think some people have become too carried away with the idea of 'the more water the better'. I just want to clarify you can have too much water, and that we all need different amounts of water depending on our body size and how active you are," nutritionist Fiona Tuck told HuffPost Australia.

"There is actually no active set water intake level people should have, and it's definitely not three or four litres, unless you are a big person and very, very active."

Tuck points out the reason why drinking water is important is so it replaces the fluid we lose during the day, and thus the amount we need to drink is directly relative to how much we are expending.

"We lose fluid by sweating or urinating, or if you've been sick or had a tummy bug, then you will need more fluid than normal," she said. "But on average, most people lose 1.5 litres per day.

"You can definitely overdose on water. Too much can dilute your blood and affect your electrolyte balance. If you drink too much water it can also put your blood pressure up."

How do I tell if I'm drinking enough/too much water?

The answer to this is pretty simple: it's all in the colour of your wee.

"The easiest way to tell if you are having enough or not enough fluid is to go by the colour of your urine," Tuck said. "It should be a pale straw colour."

"If it's dark, it means you're dehydrated. If it's completely clear, that's not a good thing either because it's too diluted."

"I mean, I want to make the point that water in general is good. We need it for healthy digestion. If, for instance, someone constipated, this can be due to not having enough fibre in the diet, but it also could be because the person is not drinking enough water to soften everything and flush it through."

We also get fluid from the foods that we eat.

Fluid from other sources

It's also important to note water isn't the only source of fluid for your body (and no, we're not talking about replacing it with Vanilla Coke).

"You do get fluid from milk and fruit and vegetables, and even from your natural digestive process," Tuck said.

"It's actually interesting how, in the warmer months, nature provides more fruit with a high water content. Things like watermelon, cucumbers, lettuce... all of these have high water content.

"Not that I'm advocating to get your water solely from foods, but it can be beneficial to eat seasonally."

Sweating is one way in which we lose fluid.

How to drink more water

If you're one of those people who definitely does need to up their water intake, but finds it difficult to drink, Tuck has a couple of tricks up her sleeve to help make the process easier.

1. Keep it within reach

Much like the wine bottle sitting on the table at dinner, you will be more likely to drink more water if it's easily accessible.

"Have it on your desk. If it's there, you're more likely to drink it," Tuck said. "I know personally, if my water bottle has run out and I don't have time to refill it, I will find myself feeling dehydrated later in the day. But if it was there, I would have drunk a litre or half a litre easily.

Keep water on your desk to remind you to rehydrate at work.

"I also think it's good to have a glass of water by your bed at nighttime. For me, I know if it's there I'll wake up and have water but if it isn't, I might forget about it.

"Basically I think we just love convenience. The easier it is the more we'll do it. If you just have a bottle of wine on the table and no water, guess what we're going to drink?"

2. Add flavour

If plain old water is simply too bland for you, try adding some chopped fruit and herbs, or make flavoured ice cubes.

"Cutting up a passion fruit and putting it in water is one of my favourite things to do. It tastes like a proper passionfruit drink," Tuck said. "You can also add mint and a slice of lemon or orange. That makes a really refreshing low calorie drink that's really hydrating and isn't an effort to drink."

"Another idea is to jazz your ice cubes up by freezing a raspberry or little sprig of mint in the ice cube tray. That way you're more likely to use them.

"If you get really stuck, try diluting fruit juice. By diluting it with water, it will not only make it go further, but it means you'll drink more water rather than the concentrated sugar from the juice."

3. Embrace herbal teas

"Herbal teas are a fantastic way to increase your water intake, though you should try not to have too much green tea or traditional black tea as they are caffeinated," Tuck said.

"Teas such as peppermint or chamomile are a really wonderful way to get water into the body that isn't just plain drinking water.

"And in terms of the summer months, just make your herbal tea, let it cool and then add ice and have it as an iced tea. You can get quite creative with water."

â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹
TITLE: 3 Easy Tips To Help You Drink More Water

SUMMARY:
Why do poor people drag their kids grocery shopping at midnight?
So there we were, the 23rd of December, and we hadn't managed to afford a single Christmas present for our kids.
What kind of parent takes their kids shopping in the middle of the night?"
I could go Christmas shopping during daylight hours--my two children in tow.
If you see a parent shopping at midnight, tired children in tow, she doesn't deserve your judgement.
TEXT:
Why do poor people drag their kids grocery shopping at midnight? originally appeared on Quora - the place to gain and share knowledge, empowering people to learn from others and better understand the world.

Answer by Jo Eberhardt, mother of two:

It was the 23rd of December 2012. My family--myself, my then-husband, and our two children were living paycheck to paycheck. No, worse than that; we were living paycheck to almost-paycheck. Anyone who has ever struggled will know how hard those last few days before payday can be.

So there we were, the 23rd of December, and we hadn't managed to afford a single Christmas present for our kids. The following day, we were due to drive to my parents' house some 8 hours away. But it was okay. Because of the Christmas public holiday, our pay was going in early. It would be available in our bank account between 1 and 2 am.

At midnight, I left my husband at home with the sleeping children and went to the shops, which were open all night for Christmas trading. There, I managed to buy a few bits and pieces for my boys and little gifts for the rest of my family. We didn't have a tree or anything, but I knew there would be one at Mum and Dad's place. Besides, it was more important to spend our only $50 on our kids than on decorations.

I got home around 3am, wrapped the presents, packed the car, and fell into bed about 5. My son woke me up at 7, and we had a family breakfast before leaving for Nana and Grandad's house.

All through the drive, all I could think about was this other family I'd seen shopping.

They were a mother and five kids. The youngest was asleep in a trolley--it was after 1am after all--and the other four were running amuck. The second-youngest would have been 4, and the eldest, 12. The mother spent her whole time yelling at them, telling them to stay with her, and threatening to return everything and cancel Christmas.

Let me tell you, the judgement must have been fairly rolling off me.

"What does she expect?" I said to my husband in disdain. "Those children should have been home in bed. What kind of parent takes their kids shopping in the middle of the night?"

Oh, I was as self-righteous as it was possible to be. Clearly she was a bad parent. There was no other explanation.

Fast forward one year.

December. Paycheck to paycheck. Only there's a difference this year.

This year, I'm a single parent.

I was lucky. Payday was on the 22nd. I could go Christmas shopping during daylight hours--my two children in tow.

But as I stood in that crowded store, frustrated and broke and at my wit's end trying to keep my children focused and near me in the overwhelming sensory-explosion that is a store at Christmas time, I remembered that frazzled mother from a year ago.

I remembered my own relief that I would have money at 1am on Christmas Eve.

I remembered the pressing guilt and grief of knowing my children would have no Christmas presents if I didn't go shopping in the middle of the night.

I now understood from personal experience that not everyone has the option of leaving their sleeping children at home with a spouse.

And I felt ashamed and embarrassed of my judgemental thoughts.

You don't know the road others walk, or the challenges they face every single day. If you see a parent shopping at midnight, tired children in tow, she doesn't deserve your judgement. She deserves your empathy.

To that mother of five who was doing the best she could: I'm sorry for judging you.
TITLE: Why I'll Never Judge That Mum Who Has Her Kids Out Shopping At Midnight

Auch die Crew reagierte panisch

Ein Air-Asia-Flugzeug verliert schnell an HÃ¶he - und die Crew die Fassung. Was sich am Sonntag wÃ¤hrend Flug QZ 535 ereignete. ist fÃ¼r manchen Reisenden wohl das Schlimmste, das in einem Flugzeug passieren kann.

Zeitgleich fielen die Sauerstoffmasken herab. Und die Flugbegleiter sollen nur noch "Anschnallen" geschrien haben.

Air Asia entschuldigte sich fÃ¼r den Zwischenfall

Doch der Pilot behielt offensichtlich die Ruhe. Er konnte das Flugzeug nach dem ManÃ¶ver umdrehen und in Australien wieder sicher landen, gab Air Asia Medien zufolge bekannt.

Die Allianz bietet zu dieser Gelegenheit Neukunden einen einmaligen Rabatt in HÃ¶he von 50 Euro beim Abschluss einer Kfz-Versicherung. â†’ Hier kÃ¶nnt ihr euch Ã¼ber die Kfz-Versicherung der Allianz informieren. â†’ Wenn ihr Fragen habt, ruft die Allianz-Hotline an: 0800 7243951 (kostenlos)

SUMMARY:
Anne Frank is known from the diary she wrote while in hiding from the Nazis during the war.
An online retailer has pulled a costume from its website that depicted Holocaust victim Anne Frank.
Just been shown this ad for an Anne Frank costume for Halloween.
Spokesman Ross Walker Smith tweeted Sunday that the costume had been pulled from the website.
Anne Frank is known from the diary she wrote while in hiding from the Nazis during the war.
TEXT:
Anne Frank is known from the diary she wrote while in hiding from the Nazis during the war.

An online retailer has pulled a costume from its website that depicted Holocaust victim Anne Frank.

Screenshots of the costume for sale at HalloweenCostumes.com posted to social media show a smiling girl wearing World War II-era clothing and a beret. The costume was quickly criticized on Twitter. Carlos Galindo-Elvira, who leads the Anti-Defamation League's Arizona office said on Twitter that the costume trivializes Frank's memory.

Totally speechless. Just been shown this ad for an Anne Frank costume for Halloween. @AnneFrankCenter you might want to have a word pic.twitter.com/mu0t4lvY62 â€” Jude Habib (@JudeHabib) October 15, 2017

North Mankato, Minnesota-based Fun.com runs the website. Spokesman Ross Walker Smith tweeted Sunday that the costume had been pulled from the website. He explained that the company sells costumes for activities other than Halloween, like "school projects and plays.'' He apologized for any offence caused by the costume.

Anne Frank is known from the diary she wrote while in hiding from the Nazis during the war.

An earlier version of this story incorrectly referred to the Anti-Defamation League as the Anti-Defence League.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Anne Frank Halloween Costume Pulled From Online Store After Complaints

TEXT:
RaStudio via Getty Images

CONSOMMATION - A son domicile, chaque FranÃ§ais jette 29 kg de nourriture par an, selon les chiffres de l'Agence de l'environnement et de la maÃ®trise de l'Ã©nergie. Ce lundi 16 octobre, la journÃ©e nationale de lutte contre le gaspillage alimentaire est l'occasion de remettre en cause ses habitudes.

Dans nos placards, Ã©tagÃ¨res, et surtout dans notre frigo, la nourriture tend Ã  s'accumuler trop longtemps. Et quand il faut jeter, on fait trop souvent confiance aux dates affichÃ©es sur l'emballage. Mais celle-ci n'a pas toujours la mÃªme signification.

La date de durabilitÃ© minimale, "Ã  consommer de prÃ©fÃ©rence avant le...", n'indique qu'une simple dÃ©gradation, sans risques, du produit. Le cafÃ© perd de son arÃ´me, les pÃ¢tisseries deviennent sÃ¨ches... A ne pas confondre avec la date limite de consommation (DLC), qui note le jour Ã  partir duquel le produit est considÃ©rÃ© comme pÃ©rimÃ©, et donc non consommable, sous risque d'intoxication alimentaire.

Mais mÃªme cette DLC est remise en question. Dans bien des cas, les produits peuvent Ãªtre mangÃ©s sans risques, quand bien mÃªme cette date fatidique serait passÃ©e. Pas besoin de les jeter immÃ©diatement, donc. Quels produits sont concernÃ©s, et comment faire le tri pour limiter le gaspillage alimentaire?

Les oeufs

Ils arrivent en grande surface avec une DLC de 28 jours. PassÃ© ce dÃ©lai, deux cas de figure se prÃ©sentent. ConsommÃ© cru, il faut Ãªtre trÃ¨s prudent, se limiter Ã  un dÃ©passement d'un ou deux jours grand maximum. ConsommÃ© cuit, ce dÃ©lai s'allonge de plusieurs semaines.

Des vÃ©rifications simples s'imposent. Si la coquille est fendillÃ©e, poubelle. Des bactÃ©ries peuvent s'y Ãªtre dÃ©veloppÃ©es. S'il est intact, vÃ©rifiez qu'une poche d'air ne s'est pas crÃ©Ã©e Ã  l'intÃ©rieur en le secouant prÃ¨s de votre oreille (vous ne devez rien entendre ou sentir bouger Ã  l'intÃ©rieur), ou en le plongeant dans l'eau (il ne doit pas flotter).

Le lait

Tant qu'elle est bien fermÃ©e, une brique ou une bouteille de lait peut se conserver un, voire deux mois de plus. C'est encore plus vrai si elle est gardÃ©e au frais. "Le mÃªme lait est vendu avec une DLC de 60 jours en France et 90 jours en Allemagne", assure Paul-Adrien Menez, fondateur de ZÃ©ro-GÃ¢chis.

Ensuite, rien de plus facile que d'identifier un lait bon Ã  jeter. Il devient rance au nez, et des paillettes blanches, voire des caillots se forment.

Les yaourts

Tous les yaourts natures peuvent Ãªtre mangÃ©s des semaines aprÃ¨s dÃ©passement de la DLC. "Un yaourt arrive en grande surface avec une DLC de 21 jours. Le mÃªme dans les DOM-TOM en affiche 28 de plus pour prendre en compte le temps de transport en bateau", explique Paul-Adrien Menez, fondateur de ZÃ©ro-GÃ¢chis.

En revanche, attention aux desserts plus Ã©laborÃ©s qui contiennent de la crÃ¨me ou de la chantilly, comme les cafÃ©s liÃ©geois. Ils peuvent tourner en quelques jours.

Si Carrefour a rÃ©ussi a augmenter la DLC de certains yaourts en marque propre, ce ne sera pas aussi facile de convaincre des industriels comme Danone et Lactalis. "Si Danone a une usine calibrÃ©e pour sortir 74.000 pots Ã  l'heure, il n'a aucun intÃ©rÃªt Ã  diminuer sa production", confie un bon connaisseur.

Viande et poisson frais

Il peut suffire de 24 ou 48 heures au-delÃ  de la date fatidique pour que l'odeur et la couleur changent. Pas de blague, les risques d'intoxication sont rÃ©els. Au moindre doute, il faut jeter.

Charcuterie

SalÃ©es, fumÃ©es, riches en graisse... Par dÃ©finition, la charcuterie est une mÃ©thode de conservation longue des viandes. D'aprÃ¨s 60 millions de consommateurs, la DLC d'un jambon blanc peut Ãªtre dÃ©passÃ©e de deux Ã  trois semaines, tant qu'il reste dans un emballage fermÃ© au frigo. Idem pour des lardons. Les saucissons se conservent davantage encore, ils vont juste perdre leur humiditÃ©.

Veillez au strict respect de la chaÃ®ne du froid. Un emballage bombÃ©e est signe qu'il est temps de jeter.

Fromages

Pour les fromages pasteurisÃ©s, on ne peut pas Ã  proprement parler de "date limite". MÃªme un fromage au lait cru comme le comtÃ© arrive en rayon aprÃ¨s des mois d'affinage.

Selon Europe 1, le reblochon "est commercialisÃ© avec une DLC de 35 jours dans l'Hexagone et de 70 jours dans les outre-mer", "tel sachet de gruyÃ¨re rÃ¢pÃ©" avec "une DLC de 40 jours" en mÃ©tropole est vendu Ã  "180 jours en outre-mer". Tout est lÃ©gal, puisque ce sont les industriels qui dÃ©cident.

Cela peut paraÃ®tre paradoxale pour des fromages, mais c'est l'apparition de moisissures qui doit vous pousser Ã  les jeter.

Bonus: le miel

C'est le seul aliment connu parfaitement imputrescible. Faites-vous plaisir !
TITLE: JournÃ©e nationale de lutte contre le gaspillage alimentaire: quels aliments peut-on manger au-delÃ  des dates limites de consommation?

TEXT:
En mis aÃ±os de trabajo he visto muchÃ­simas escenas abrumadoras de fans con celebridades. Siempre he pensado que la manera en que uno se acerca y se comporta frente a una persona famosa dice mucho de lo que uno es, de lo que uno ha vivido y del lugar en el que uno se coloca en el mundo.

Y de todas esas escenas abrumadoras, ninguna como el comportamiento de las senadoras mexicanas frente a Trudeau.

"Los fans son, en muchos aspectos, la sublimaciÃ³n del modelo de consumidor de cultura vulgar carente de cualquier clase de gusto", dice el prefacio del libro FanÃ¡ticos, la cultura fan, de Daniel Aranda, Jordi SÃ¡nchez-Navarro y Antoni Roig.

Una cosa es el comportamiento desmedido de las masas en un concierto u otro evento que mueva a fondo cualquier tipo de emociones. Otra cosa, muy distinta, es que el trabajo de uno implique tener acceso a eventos donde los personajes mÃ¡s poderosos, famosos o inaccesibles de una sociedad estÃ¡n al alcance de una selfie, pero que tu responsabilidad sea retratar ese momento y no retratarte con ellos, pero que tu responsabilidad sea estar a la altura de alguien honorable por los resultados de tu trabajo, y no que seas conocida por haberte colado hasta el frente del montÃ³n y logrado una fotografÃ­a.

No he encontrado en las redes que ninguna de estas personas que tuvieron la oportunidad de tener a su lado a Justin Trudeau, anote como recuerdo una respuesta o una frase que puede uno obtener en segundos de convivencia. No sÃ©, sobre cÃ³mo ha empujado leyes para que el gobierno canadiense sea mÃ¡s transparente o sobre las modificaciones al plan de pensiones que darÃ¡ un mejor futuro a los canadienses cuando se retiren. Ok puede que no sea tan clavado, algo sobre su apoyo a la comunidad LGBT o su feminismo, pero algo que nos deje mejor parados que pedir un selfie.

SUSCRÃBETE Y SÃGUENOS Enviarme diariamente por correo electrÃ³nico los blogs y las notas mÃ¡s destacadas. EntÃ©rate de mÃ¡s Newsletter Por favor escribe una direcciÃ³n de correo electrÃ³nico Â¡Gracias por suscribirte! Pronto estarÃ¡s recibiendo un correo para confirmar tu suscripciÃ³n. No puede causarme mayor desagrado ver cÃ³mo dentro de Palacio Nacional, la reportera de Radio FÃ³rmula le grita un "Â¡te amo!" al primer ministro de CanadÃ¡, mientras le da la mano cuando le dieron permiso de tomarse una foto. Â¿QuÃ© manera de comportarse es esa?No es Luis Miguel ni Ricky Martin, no es un cantante de pop que busca provocar que su pÃºblico arda de pasiÃ³n, ni ella es la fan que dejaron entrar al backstage y que tendrÃ¡ el momento mÃ¡s emocionante de su vida.

No se trata de lo que piense Justin Trudeau. Igual le parece simpÃ¡tico, igual le parece fuera de lugar. Se trata de la formalidad que rige los actos y ceremonias diplomÃ¡ticos y oficiales. El protocolo es una prÃ¡ctica relevante que hay que cumplir porque estÃ¡ establecida a partir de la historia y la cultura, porque son los buenos modales que mostramos a un invitado. Y que si el presidente de MÃ©xico decide romper y darle la oportunidad a la mujer de tomarse una foto, quÃ© mal gusto el grito de "te amo" de la periodista al primer ministro que estÃ¡ acompaÃ±ado de su mujer.

Maru Rojas, reportera de @Radio_Formula, pidiÃ³ en un acto oficial si podÃ­a tomarse una foto con el Primer Ministro de CanadÃ¡, Justin Trudeau pic.twitter.com/H3LEAx1fjU â€” BuzzFeed News MÃ©xico (@BuzzFeedNewsMex) October 13, 2017

Reportera le declara su amor a Justin Trudeau y con su esposa enfrente ğŸ˜±

https://t.co/QH5BFBTuRFpic.twitter.com/hY0kkzdnWL â€” Publimetro MX (@PublimetroMX) October 13, 2017

Pero la periodista es creo que menos grave, en todo caso. Quienes sÃ­ rebasaron toda imaginaciÃ³n de lo absurdo fueron los senadores. Amontonados en los pasillos de la sede como si fuera el Foro Sol, nuevamente, como si ellos tuvieran 17 aÃ±os, no tuvieran nada de mundo y Justin Trudeau fuera Bono, se empujaron, rompiendo protocolo, para tomarse la selfie.

Luego, cuando el primer ministro canadiense se pronunciÃ³ frente a ellos con un discurso, le aplaudieron emocionados. Trudeau les recordÃ³ la frase de JuÃ¡rez que estÃ¡ en la pared frontal del salÃ³n, y que ellos deben leer y tener presente cada dÃ­a: "Entre los individuos como entre las naciones, el derecho al respeto ajeno es la paz". HipÃ³critas, como si Trudeau les estuviera inspirando. Â¿CÃ³mo? Â¿Por quÃ© aplauden asÃ­? Porque Trudeau la lee en espaÃ±ol. Â¿Por quÃ© si ellos no le dan importancia? QuÃ© bonito se siente Trudeau que nos recuerdes que esas palabras de JuÃ¡rez son elocuentes, quÃ© agradable que nos recuerdes algo que no respetamos, que no hacemos valer, mientras Ãºnicamente nos enfocamos a ejercer la parte de la polÃ­tica que se trata de mantener el poder. Porque no sabemos hacer otra cosa mÃ¡s que ser hipÃ³critas en la vida real y en las redes sociales, cobrar sueldos y bonos, romper protocolos y abusar del poder.

Los presentes no debieron aplaudir, sino agachar la cabeza de pena porque precisamente no cumplen bien con su chamba. "Ayer que me reunÃ­ con miembros de la sociedad civil, escuchÃ© historias sobre el trato a las mujeres y a las niÃ±as que no son aceptables", dijo Trudeau para retar a quienes se dedican a aprobar y modificar leyes en nuestro paÃ­s. En Puebla, por ejemplo, el gobierno no ha activado la alerta de gÃ©nero cuando los casos de desapariciÃ³n de mujeres han aumentado alrededor de 2,000% en los Ãºltimos aÃ±os. Â¿QuÃ© dicen los representantes de aquel estado? Tengan un poco de vergÃ¼enza, seÃ±ores. Tengan un poco de madre y hagan su trabajo.

Y ya como mal chiste, Â¿por quÃ© nadie le dijo a Ernesto Cordero que el nombre del primer ministro canadiense se pronuncia con o y no con u? "Bienvenido 'Yustin'", dijo el Presidente del Senado, actuario egresado del ITAM con una maestrÃ­a en la Universidad de Pensilvania.

David Jolly, who represented a Florida district, called Trump â€œunstableâ€ and â€œrisky when it comes to matters of national securityâ€ in an interview with MSNBCâ€™s Lawrence Oâ€™Donnell on Monday night.
He said:â€œI personally as a Republican in the past few weeks have wondered, is the republic safer if Democrats take over the House in 2018.
I raised that issue with the leading Republican in D.C. last week, and the remarkable thing is he had been thinking exactly the same thing.

TEXT:
A former Republican lawmaker says the nation might be better off if Democrats win back the House of Representatives in next yearâ€™s midterm election to help keep President Donald Trump in check.

David Jolly, who represented a Florida district, called Trump â€œunstableâ€ and â€œrisky when it comes to matters of national securityâ€ in an interview with MSNBCâ€™s Lawrence Oâ€™Donnell on Monday night.

He said:

â€œI personally as a Republican in the past few weeks have wondered, is the republic safer if Democrats take over the House in 2018. I raised that issue with the leading Republican in D.C. last week, and the remarkable thing is he had been thinking exactly the same thing. This is a president that needs a greater check on his power than Republicans in Congress have offered.â€

Jolly suggested it could be a matter of national security.

â€œWe do know that we have a president who very well might put this nation at risk and this Republican Congress has done nothing to check his power,â€ he added. â€œDemocrats could, and we might be better off as a republic if they take the House in 2018.â€

Jolly, who won a House seat in a 2014 special election and then won re-election later that year, has been a frequent Trump critic who in August called him â€œan ill-tempered, unqualified and at times dangerous leader of the free world.â€

A one-time critic of the Affordable Care Act, Jolly changed his mind after he lost his House seat last year and became unemployed.
TITLE: Former GOP Rep. David Jolly: 'We Might Be Better Off' If Democrats Win The House
